title.narrative: Bangladesh - Employment Generation Program for the Poorest

description.narrative: The objective of the Employment Generation Program for the Poorest Project (EGPP) for Bangladesh is to provide the short-term employment on community sub-projects to enable households to better cope with vulnerability, while strengthening program implementation. There are two components to the components to the project. The project follows a results-based financing mechanism and disbursement-linked indicators (DLIs) representing targets to trigger disbursement are specified for each year of implementation of the Government program of the same name. One DLI focus area pertains to the use of a specific geographic targeting formula to allocate fiscal resources to ensure pro-poor coverage. The DLI target for 2013, for this focus area, will need to be changed as the follow-on Safety Net Systems for the Poorest (SNSP) Project, which will commence implementation and support the same Government program during the same year, includes an updated geographic targeting formula based on new national poverty statistics. It was agreed during negotiations for the SNSP Project that the new DLI targets agreed for the Government program will apply to the EGPP Project, thereby necessitating an amendment to the EGPP project's financing agreement. This will constitute a level two restructuring. The changes will amend the DLI target for geographic targeting in 2013 to ensure that the provisions under the EGPP Financing Agreement, and the recently signed SNSP financing agreement, are aligned.

condition.narrative: Employ the services of a qualified procurement expert to assist the Recipient in carrying out the procurement process under theProject in the first twelve months of the Project
Maintain a Technical ProjectReview Committee, headed by the Project Director, to assist in Project and Program implementation inaccordance to the Finance Agreement
National Steering Committee, headed by the Secretary, Disaster Managementand Relief Division, to provide policy advice andoversight for effective project implementation
Project will set up the Project Director's Office including the recruitment of necessary project staff for project implementation

title.narrative: Number of individuals participating in short-term employment created by the Program

baseline.value: 1,997,075 beneficiaries registered for the 100 day EGP (during food crisis)

comment.narrative: This represents a SP core indicator.

target.value: at least 663,000 beneficiaries in each phase of program (assuming GoB allocation as in year 1)

comment.narrative: Random spot checks indicate over 90% of the same beneficiaries participate in both phases (PPRC, Qualitative Assessment, Oct2013-Jan 2014)

title.narrative: Beneficiaries of Safety Nets programs - Female (number)

comment.narrative: this represents 33% of 663000 i.e. the end target for the number of individuals participating in the program
279363 female beneficiaries registered in FY 2014 (Phase I)

title.narrative: Beneficiaries of Safety Nets programs - Cash-for-work, food-for-work and public works (number)

comment.narrative: One Program participant per household, providing income during lean seasons to help smoothen consumption. Actual figure =individuals x 4.4 (average household size, as per Population & Housing Census 2011). This figure is for FY 2014 (Phase 1).

title.narrative: Percentage of EGPP participants receiving payments through formal financial channels

target.value: payments in 95% of UPs which have been made by banks or formal financial channels in each phase

title.narrative: Percentage of EGPP participants who are women
% of wage costs allocated to high poverty areas

baseline.value: 100 Day EGP covered all 64 districts and 480 upazilas where resources were not allocated explicitly to higher poverty upazilas

target.value: Actual allocations from Ministry to upazilas remain as per program guidelines and a minimum of 45% of actual expenditures on wagecosts in each phase going to upazilas with extreme poverty rates of 35 percent and higher

actual.value: 45% of wage costs allocated to areas wtih 40% or higher poverty rates

comment.narrative: The allocation formula was changed in FY 14 based on updated poverty maps and is as per the program guidelines

title.narrative: Number of person days of short-term employment created

baseline.value: 90 million person days in 100 Day EGP (during food crisis)

title.narrative: Percentage of households of EGPP beneficiaries are from hosueholds owning less than 0.5 acres of land and are engaged in manual labour

baseline.value: 94% of beneficiaries in 100 Day EGP had less than 0.5 acres of land; 73% of heads of beneficiary hosueholds were manual labourers

target.value: At least 80% of beneficiaries in each phase are both engaged in manual labour and own less than 0.5 acres of land

actual.value: 94.1 % of beneficairies are engaged in manual labour and 100 percent owned less than 0.5 acres of land

title.narrative: Number of participating upazilas that have input beneficiary lists into an electronice beneficiary level database

target.value: 100% unions that will make payments through banks will have beneficiary lists into an electronic beneficary database at the upazilalevel

title.narrative: Number of contracted field supervisors in upazilas wth poverty rates of 21% or higher

target.value: 90% of field supervisor positions are filled during each phase

actual.value: 100% of field supervisor positions are fulfilled

title.narrative: Percentage of upazilas where grievance redress system is functioning

target.value: grievance redress system functional in 75% of upazilas

actual.value: grievance redress system functional in 100% of the Upazilas

title.narrative: Percentage of sub-projects using 10-20% of project resources for non-wage costs

target.value: 75% of sub-projects using 10-20% of project actual expenditures for non-wage costs

title.narrative: Percentage of sub-projects that have signboards at worksites and publicly available beneficiary lists

baseline.value: No requirement for signboards or pubicly available beneficiary lists

target.value: 75% of sub-projects have have signboards at worksites and publicly available beneficiary lists

title.narrative: Percentage of community sub-projects whose progress reports were prepared using stadardized monitoring formats each program phase

target.value: Community sub-project-level progress reports prepared each phase for 90% of sub-projects
